alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:39PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Tuscaloosa County through 730 PM CDT... At 639 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bankhead Lock And Dam to 7 miles northwest of Deerlick Creek Campgrounds. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake View, Brookwood, Coaling, Vance, Tannehill Ironworks State Park, Bull City, Abernant, Lake Wildwood, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Mercedes Benz Of Alabama, Bankhead Lock And Dam, North Bibb, Lake Tuscaloosa, East Brookwood, Peterson, Lake Harris, Lake Nicol, Caffee Junction, Highway 69 Bridge and Fleetwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
